page.title: 12FARMING
page.content: Woore is in the{dairy-farming}area of North Shropshire and Cheshire. Most of the acreage is given over to {cultivated pasture}either for feeding the cows directly or making silage. There are some fields of{barley or {rape,}and one farmer in Dorrington has gone over to{sheep}rather than cattle. Modern methods of milking and cultivation mean little employment on the farms. There are{10 sizeable}farms in the area, and some smaller holdings. {Hedges}and{small woodlands}have generally been left intact, but the varieties of{grasses and wild flowers which used to be found in the old hay-meadows are disappearing as the farmers cultivate the fields. There is a{nursery}and greenhouses near Irelands Cross. This sells mainly plants and shrubs for gardens.
